thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: U.S. drillers boost oil rig count to highest nearly 3 years -Baker Hughes

title: U.S. drillers boost oil rig count to highest nearly 3 years -Baker Hughes
text: February 9, 2018 / 6:17 PM / in 21 minutes U.S. drillers boost oil rig count to highest nearly 3 years -Baker Hughes Reuters Staff 3 Min Read By Scott DiSavino Feb 9   The increase in the week to Feb. 9 was the biggest weekly rise since January 2017, General Electric Co's Baker Hughes energy services firm said in its closely followed report on Friday. RIG-OL-USA-BHI   U.S. crude prices on Friday fell through $60 a barrel for the first time since December and have tumbled more than 11 percent from this year's   Looking ahead, futures were trading above $57 for the balance of 2018 and below $54 for calendar 2019 . In anticipation of higher prices in 2018 than 2017, U.S. financial services firm Cowen & Co said 36 of the roughly 65 E&Ps they track, including Pioneer Natural Resources Corp , have already provided capital expenditure guidance indicating an 8 percent increase in planned spending over 2017. Pioneer said it expects to spend about $2.65 billion in drilling and completions in 2018. Cowen said that was up 1 percent from 2017. Cowen said the E&Ps it tracks planned to spend about $66.1 billion on drilling and completions in the lower 48 U.S. states in 2017, about 53 percent over what they planned to spend in 2016.       The current all-time U.S. output annual peak was in 1970 at 9.6 million bpd, according to federal energy data. (Reporting by Scott DiSavino; Editing by Marguerita Choy)
